physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Acute respiratory distress, cyanosis, respiratory arrest requiring non-invasive ventilation. Chest auscultation was normal one hour later; Peak expiratory flow rate was 500 l/min.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At three days post-admission, the patient's asthma was prescribed medications including formoterol and methylprednisolone. On day 5, FEV1 was 3.22 l (85% predicted) and FVC 4.8 l (105% predicted), showing improvement. However, three minutes after a puff of salbutamol, there was a 25% drop in FEV1.
